Soup Dumplings
120ml water
50g butter
3/4 teaspoon salt
80g flour
1 teaspoon mustard
2 eggs, beaten
chives, finely chopped
parsley, finely chopped
  1. Fill a pot with salted water and boil
  2. Put the butter, water and salt in a small saucepan and melt over medium heat
  3. Add the ï¬‚our and stir until the dough steams a bit and starts to smell nutty, but without coloring - about 4-5 minutes
  4. Take off the heat and mix in the mustard
  5. Gradually beat in the egg, then the herbs
  6. Form the dumplings, and cook in the boiling water for about 5 minutes (open one to see if its done)
Footer. Not much here really. Nice to have a footer though.
